TopicTitle: How do I make my own Mods?

Articles.Content: I have moved this question to its own thread in the mod forum. You might also want to read some of the threads at the top of this forum for mod creation advice.
Look at the in the support i think 'ksp blender tutorial'

you have 2 choices. 2 shalt be the number of the choices and the number of the choices shalt be 2:

1: do some custom 3d work and make all the info and stuff for it.

2: modify the .cfg file inside the part file, and if needed to, contact the author for Ok'ing

you have 2 choices. 2 shalt be the number of the choices and the number of the choices shalt be 2:

1: do some custom 3d work and make all the info and stuff for it.

2: modify the .cfg file inside the part file, and if needed to, contact the author for Ok'ing

Also, NEVER release a cfg edit unless it is really useful and not cheaty.

How are plugins made? Is there an api that is leveraged? Or any documentation to work from?

I found the information on the wiki for starting plugin module development, so I think I'm good there.

Anyone have any good code examples/open source material I can learn from? I think I've got navigating Unity's documentation down as well, though using it for the first time will probably be shaky.

Edited September 12, 2012 by fusty

All the plugin developers post their source code, or a link to it, so I'd suggest having a look at whichever one most approximates what you want to do.

But of course get their permission and credit them if you end up making a plugin that uses some of their code
